measured_by: motion coherence level of random-dot motion stimuli
justification: The article states that perceptual uncertainty was manipulated and indexed by “motion coherence” in the random-dot motion paradigm.

measured_by: angular offset between motion direction and category boundary
justification: Categorical uncertainty is explicitly defined as “the angular offset between motion direction and a criterion (category boundary).”
After each decision, “participants rated their desire to change their mind on a continuous scale,” which the authors used to “quantify subjective uncertainty.”
construct: Subjective uncertainty / desire to change mind

measured_by: difference score between Z-scored change-of-mind ratings on error vs. correct trials
justification: To assess metacognitive sensitivity the authors “subtracted Z-scored change of mind values on correct trials from those on error trials,” with larger differences indicating better metacognitive sensitivity.
The CPP is described as “a neural marker of evidence accumulation,” and its amplitude over a centro-parietal electrode cluster is analysed to index this construct.

measured_by: EEG neural tuning strength derived from Mahalanobis distance decoding
justification: The authors compute “an aggregate metric of tuning strength” from Mahalanobis-distance decoding to capture how strongly motion direction is represented neurally.
